text:
You can unlock your Mac
with a paired Apple Watch
using a feature called autolock.
To set up this feature,
you need a compatible Apple Watch and Mac
signed in to the same iCloud account.
Before you can use autolock,

make sure that your devices
meet these criteria:

your Apple Watch is
running watchOS 3 or newer;
your Mac is running macOS Sierra or newer;

or if you have an Apple
Watch Series 3 or newer,
you need macOS High Sierra or newer.

Make sure they're signed in
to the same iCloud account
and they both have passcode setup.

Log in to your Mac and open
the system preferences menu.
You can do this by clicking the Apple logo
and selecting "System Preferences."

Open security and privacy
and click on the general tab.
With your iPhone unlocked
and your Apple Watch on your wrist,

check off the box labeled
"Use your Apple Watch
to unlock apps and your Mac."
When prompted, enter your Mac's password.

Quick note: The first time
you log in after you turn off,
restart, or log out of your Mac,

you'll still need to enter
your password manually.
You should now be able to unlock your Mac
without entering its password

just by wearing your Apple
Watch when you wake it.
